full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 467 Filed 11/15/21 Page 147 of 158 147 LBAAMAX5ps Rocchio - Cross 1 A. Yes. 2 Q. OK. And of that half, we've got 67 males in that population. Correct? 3 4 A. No. 5 Q. 67 male and female adult survivors. Right? 6 A. 76 percent of whom were identifying as female. 7 Q. Right. So at least 50 percent disclosed before the age of 8 19 according to this study. Right? 9 A. Correct. 10 Q. And we don't know how delayed this reporting was or was not. 11 12 A. You mean disclosures that were made prior to the age of 19? 13 Q. Right. 14 A. Again, not in this summary. I'd have to look to see whether that was addressed in the article itself. But, no, that's not referenced in the summary. 15 16 Q. OK. But you didn't do that in preparation for your testimony here today, correct? 17 18 A. This particular study? 19 Q. Correct. 20 21 A. No, I don't believe I did. 22 Q. OK. The next one down, Leclerc and Wortley, 2015. Now, you spent some time talking about offender-generated data as part of the basis for your opinion, correct? 23 24 25 A. Yes. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00007326
